// user.js
var $ = require('jquery');
function User(name) {
  this.name = name;
  this.followers = 0;
}
User.prototype.fetch = function(){
  return $.ajax({
    url: 'https://api.github.com/users/' + this.name,
    method: 'get',
    dataType: 'json'
  }).then(function(data){
      this.followers = data.followers;
  }.bind(this));
};
module.exports = User;

function followerOf(user, repo) {
  user.fetch().then(repo.fetch).then(function(_){
    $('#content').text(user.name +"'s followers: " + user.followers +
                       " and his repo "+ repo.name +"'s followers:" + repo.followers);
    });
};

module.exports = followerOf;







1. Auto Mock

entry.title: moz-request.js
entry.content:
var Request = require("sdk/request").Request;
var request = function(url, method, data){
    var res = $.Deferred();
    Request({
      url: url,
      content: data,
      onComplete: function (response) {
        res.resovle(response.json);
      }
    })[method]();
    return res;
}

module.exports = request
["var Request = require("sdk/request").Request;", "var request = function(url, method, data){", "    var res = $.Deferred();", "    Request({", "      url: url,", "      content: data,", "      onComplete: function (response) {", "        res.resovle(response.json);", "      }", "    })[method]();", "    return res;", "}", "", "module.exports = request"]

var Monad = function(type, defs) {

max 3 4
(max 3) 4



ç»“æœéƒ½æ˜¯4, è¿™æœ‰è®¾ä¹ˆç”¨å‘¢.



è¿™é‡Œçœ‹ä¸å‡ºæ¥, æ”¾åˆ°é«˜é˜¶å‡½æ•°è¯•è¯•. ä»€ä¹ˆ? çœ‹ä¸æ‡‚å¤©ä¹¦ Haskell, æ¥çœ‹çœ‹ JavaScript å§.




æˆ‘ä»¬æ¥è§£ä¸€ä¸ªé—®é¢˜




1. å†™ä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°, å¯ä»¥è¿æ¥å­—ç¬¦æ•°ç»„, å¦‚ f(['1','2']) => '12'




å¥½å§,å¦‚æœä¸ç”¨æŸ¯é‡ŒåŒ–, æ€ä¹ˆå†™? å•Šå“ˆ reduce



var concatArray = function(chars){
  return chars.reduce(function(a, b){
    return a.concat(b);
  });
}
concat(['1','2','3']) // => '123'



å¾ˆç®€å•,å¯¹å§.




2. ç°åœ¨æˆ‘è¦å…¶ä¸­æ‰€æœ‰æ•°å­—åŠ 1, ç„¶ååœ¨è¿æ¥



var concatArray = function(chars, inc){
  return chars.map(function(char){
    return (+char)+inc + '';
  }).reduce(function(a,b){
      return a.concat(b)
  });
}
console.log(concatArray(['1','2','3'], 1))// => '234'




3. æ‰€æœ‰æ•°å­—ä¹˜ä»¥2, å†é‡æ„è¯•è¯•çœ‹



var multiple = function(a, b){
  return +a*b + ''
}
var concatArray = function(chars, inc){
  return chars.map(function(char){
    return multiple(char, inc);
  }).reduce(function(a,b){
      return a.concat(b)
  });
}
console.log(concatArray(['1','2','3'], 2)) // => '246'



æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å·²ç»çœ‹å‡ºé—®é¢˜äº†å‘¢? å¦‚æœæˆ‘åœ¨éœ€è¦æ¯ä¸ªæ•°å­—éƒ½å‡2,æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å¾ˆéº»çƒ¦å‘¢.éœ€è¦å°†map å‚æ•°åŒ¿åå‡½æ•°ä¸­çš„ multiple å‡½æ•°æ¢æ‰. è¿™æ ·ä¸€æ¥concatArrayå°±ä¸èƒ½åŒæ—¶å¤„ç†åŠ , ä¹˜å’Œå‡? é‚£ä¹ˆæ€ä¹ˆèƒ½æŠŠä»–æå–å‡ºæ¥å‘¢? æ¥å¯¹æ¯”ä¸‹æŸ¯é‡ŒåŒ–çš„è§£æ³•.




æŸ¯é‡ŒåŒ–å‡½æ•°æ¥å£



var multiple = function(a){
  return function(b){
    return +b*a + ''
  }
}

var plus = function(a){
  return function(b){
    return (+b)+a + ''
  }
}
var concatArray = function(chars, stylishChar){
  return chars.map(stylishChar)
    .reduce(function(a,b){
      return a.concat(b)
  });
}
console.log(concatArray(['1','2','3'], multiple(2)))
console.log(concatArray(['1','2','3'], plus(2)))



æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆä¸ä¸€æ ·å‘¢
1. å¤„ç†æ•°ç»„ä¸­å­—ç¬¦çš„å‡½æ•°è¢«æå–å‡ºæ¥, ä½œä¸ºå‚æ•°ä¼ å…¥
2. æå–æˆæŸ¯é‡ŒåŒ–çš„å‡½æ•°, éƒ¨åˆ†é…ç½®å¥½åä¼ å…¥, å¥½å¤„æ˜¾è€Œæ˜“è§, è¿™ä¸‹æ¥å£éå¸¸é€šç•…
æ— è®ºæ˜¯å¤–å±‚è°ƒç”¨



concatArray(['1','2','3'], multiple(2))




è¿˜æ˜¯å†…éƒ¨çš„ map å‡½æ•°



chars.map(stylishChar)




è¿™äº›æ¥å£éƒ½æ¸…æ™°äº†å¾ˆå¤š, ä¸æ˜¯å—



è¿™å°±æ˜¯å‡½æ•°å¼çš„æ€æƒ³, ç”¨å·²æœ‰çš„å‡½æ•°ç»„åˆå‡ºæ–°çš„å‡½æ•°, è€ŒæŸ¯é‡ŒåŒ–æ¯æ¶ˆè´¹ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°, éƒ½ä¼šè¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„éƒ¨åˆ†é…ç½®çš„å‡½æ•°, è¿™ä¸ºå‡½æ•°ç»„åˆæä¾›äº†æ›´çµæ´»çš„æ‰‹æ®µ, å¹¶ä¸”ä½¿å¾—æ¥å£æ›´ä¸ºæµç•….



å†åŠ ä¸Šè‡ªåŠ¨æŸ¯é‡ŒåŒ–çš„åº“ ramda, ç®€ç›´å°±å®Œç¾äº†

  return +b*a + ''
})
var plus = ramda.curry(function(a, b){
  return (+b)+a + ''

entry.title: Why do we still need Evernote since there is awesome gist.github.com
entry.content:
I'm a Emacs user and as you may know there is a awesome mode called gist.el, and since then, I found that it's completely my Evernote replacement. Why replace Evernote with gist?



    

  • 
code snippet (very significant reason)
    • 

  • 
Version Control, gist actually is a git repo, so you have all the commit history.
    • 

  • Social, fork, star, and comment as well.
    • 

  • I have emacs open all the time my machine is on. no reason open another app for note taking.
    • 

  • annoying Evernote text editor without emacs like shotcut.
    • 

  • Github Flavored Markdown(with emoji), or even org-mode and reStructuredText support.
    • 




But since there are not so many Emacsers, I create a Atom package glist which do the exact thing as gist.el for Atom.io. as atom support markdown instant preview, note taking with gist is even better.



Anyway there is still one thing gist cannot replace evernote -- web cliper. So I'm working on a simple chrome extension do the exact thing -- clipping web as markdown to gist.github.com

entry.title: Build Yourself a Backbone.js Step by Step
entry.content:
Install Node



brew install node



node here is use for setup tools like grunt and mocha



npm install -g grunt



grunt is js build tool.



npm install -g bower



bower is package management for frontend js.




Install Dependencies



npm install



this will install all dependecies under package.json



  "devDependencies": {
    "grunt": "~0.4.2",
    "nunjucks": "~1.0.1",
    "grunt-nunjucks": "~0.1.0",
    "grunt-contrib-copy": "~0.5.0",
    "grunt-contrib-concat": "~0.3.0",
    "mocha": "~1.17.1",
    "grunt-contrib-uglify": "~0.3.2",
    "grunt-contrib-watch": "~0.5.3",
    "requirejs": "~2.1.11",
    "grunt-mocha": "~0.4.10"
}




Install Frontend Dependencies



bower install



same thing, bower install will install all dependencies of bower.json



 "devDependencies": {
 "bootswatch": "~3.1.1",
    "nunjucks": "~1.0.1",
    "chai": "~1.9.0",
    "sinon": "~1.8.2"
}




Run the mocha test



grunt mocha to run test with phantomjs



or just open tests/index.html with your browser.



chai is for assertion



nunjucks.render.calledOnce.should.be.true;



sinon for mock



sinon.stub(nunjucks,"render")




Precompile Template



we use nunjucks for template engine



nunjucks is very effective and powerful since it support precompile of templates, and python-like syntax.



grunt-nunjucks will compile the templates for us through grunt task



   nunjucks: {
      precompile: {
        src: 'src/templates/*',
        dest: 'javascripts/templates.js'
      }
    }



run grunt nunjucks will precompile all templates under src/templates/ into javascripts/tempalates.js




Generate Github API Token



open https://github.com/settings/applications and click generate token






copy the token. KEEP IT AS SAFE AS YOUR GITHUB PASSWORD




Run the app



simply run grunt will precomile nunjucks and copy javascripts from src into javascripts folder.



then python -m SimpleHTTPServer to start a server.



open localhost:8000



open console and put it



localStorage.setItem("access_token",<PASTE>); <RETURN>




refresh and you will see...





DONE






TASK 1



get all gist list and render them into home page.




Check Points



    

  1. ajax get data.
    2. 

  2. use nunjucks to render your data.
    3. 

  3. mocha test your async code.
    4. 





TASK 1 Walkthrough




Get Gist Data via API



function getGists(){
  return Q($.ajax({
    url:"https://api.github.com/users/"+login_user+"/gists?access_token=" + localStorage.getItem("access_token"),
    method:'get'
  }));
};



now we have the data, what we need to do is render the data into template, then put it on the page.



the data is wrapped with Q which will return a Promise object. with Promise, you can do



Q(do something aync).then(console.log)




Template



function renderGist(){
    getGists().then(function(body){
        $('.container .article').html(nunjucks.render("src/templates/gistlist.html",{gists:body}));
    }).then(bindEvent);
}



see, then nunjuncks.render will take 2 arguments, first the template address, then the data.



lets see what is in the template



<ul class="list-group">
    {% for gist in gists %}
    {% for name,file in gist.files%}
    <li class="list-group-item">
        <a href="#" data-id="{{gist.id}}" data-url="{{gist.html_url}}">
            {{name}}
        </a>
  </li>
    {% endfor%}
    {% endfor%}
</ul>



simple ehh, print the data value with {{}}



but how nunjucks find the template html.



a grunt task will precompile all html template file into javascript/templates.js



    nunjucks: {
      precompile: {
        src: 'src/templates/*',
        dest: 'javascripts/templates.js'
      }
    },




Test



how to test function with promise



    describe('article',function(){
        it('show all gist', function(done){
            var gists = [{
                html_url:"https://gist.github.com/2171fd506edc072ca80e"
            }];
            var gistsData = Q(gists);
            getGists = stub().returns(gistsData);
            renderGist();
            gistsData.should.be.fulfilled.then(function(){
                nunjucks.render.calledOnce.should.be.true;
                nunjucks.render.getCall(0).args[0].should.be.equal("src/templates/gistlist.html");
                nunjucks.render.getCall(0).args[1].should.be.deep.equal({gists:gists});
            }).should.notify(done);
        });
    });



the .should.be.fulfilled.then and notify is provide by chai promise plugin.



this test will check



    

  1. if the getGists is been called
    2. 

  2. the Promise it returned should be fulfilled.
    3. 

  3. nunjucks.render has been called
    4. 

  4. nunjucks.render has been called with the right data.
    5. 

  5. finally notify the done callback provide by mocha, which tell moche the test has been done.
    6. 




BTW change the before and after to beforeEach, why



TASK 2: Play with Event



Bind event to items in the gists list, when I click, the content of the gist will be rendered.



Gists List




then detail page:






tip: use this api to get gist content https://gist.github.com/<YOURNAME>/<GIST ID>.json





example: https://gist.github.com/jcouyang/9362622.json




Check points



    

  1. use JSONP to cross origin ajax
    2. 

  2. get data and render is async, make sure bind event after render.
    3. 





TASK 2 Walkthrough




Cross Domain Ajax



$.getJSON($(this).data("url")+".json?callback=?"



use getJSON and add callback=? to get JSONP across origin




bind event



your code will may like this:



getGists().then(function(body){
        $('.container .article').html(nunjucks.render("src/templates/gistlist.html",{gists:body}));
}).then(bindEvent);

function bindEvent(){
    $(".article li a").click(function(){
        $.getJSON($(this).data("url")+".json?callback=?",function(data){
            $(".article").html(data.div);
        });
    });
}

renderHeader().then(renderGist);



bind event after render



now you'll find 2 problems here



    

  1. repeat code.
    2. 

  2. how to go back from the gist detail page.
    3. 




TASK 3



now your code should have repeat code



each time you want to add something new to the page, you'll probalily copy this code and make some minor change:



function renderGist(){
    getGists().then(function(body){
        $('.container .article').html(nunjucks.render("src/templates/gistlist.html",{gists:body}));
    }).then(bindEvent);
}



Once you have to copy and paste your code, that means you need refactory



look at the code and you'll see the common things:
1. get Data from backend
2. use the data to render template
3. bind event to the element after the template rendered.



So, TASK 3 would be:



extract the View out of the common code




Check Points



    

  1. remove repeat code and replace them with View
    2. 

  2. View can be extend -- inheritance
    3. 

  3. View should be easy to use like backbone

    4. 





Hint:



this will explain how to implement simple javascript inheritance using underscore



function Mammal(name){ 
    this.name=name;
    this.offspring=[];
} 
Mammal.prototype.toString=function(){ 
    return '[Mammal "'+this.name+'"]';
}

Mammal.extend = function(props){
    var parent = this,child;
    child = function(){
        parent.apply(this, arguments)
    }
    var FixConstructor = function(){
        this.constructor = child;
    };
    FixConstructor.prototype = parent.prototype
    child.prototype = new FixConstructor();
    _.extend(child, parent);
    _.extend(child.prototype,props);
    return child;
}

var Cat = Mammal.extend({type:"Cat"})
var cat = new Cat("meow")




Walkthrough




prototype



 +----------------+ prototype+-----------------+
 |   Function     +----------+  function       |     
 +-------+--------+          +-----------------+     
           |                                               
           |Mammal instanceof Function === true            
           |.constructor                                           
   +-------+--------+ prototype+----------------+              
   | Mammal         +----------+  empty Object {}              
   +----------------+          +----------------+              




..  .. .   .   .   .   .Mammal.prototype.toString=function() .............



 +------------------+            +----------------------+
 |     Mammal       |.prototype  | {}.toString          |
 +------------------+            +-----------+----------+
 |      .extend     |                        ^ 
 +------------------+                        | 




.......^.......var mammal= new Mammal("dog")  .|...................
         |                                       |toString
         |    Object.getPrototypeOf  +-----------+-----------+
         +---------------------------+  mammal               |
             .constructor            +-----------------------+




constructor



as you can see here, Mammal.constructor == Function



mammal.constructor == Mammal



so function Mammal() just like create new instance of Function




Function



    

  1. Function
    2. 




new Function (arg1, arg2, ... argN, functionBody)



    

  1. function statment
    2. 




function name([param[, param[, ... param]]]) {
   statements
   }



    

  1. function operater/expression
    2. 




function [name]([param] [, param] [..., param]) {
   statements
}



    

  1. Function constructor vs. function declaration vs. function expression
    2. 




Function constructor



var multiply = new Function("x", "y", "return x * y;");




function declaration



function multiply(x, y) {
   return x * y;
}




function expression



var multiply = function(x, y) {
   return x * y;
};




named function expression



var multiply = function func_name(x, y) {
   return x * y;
};





implement the inheritance of View,just like the mammal:



View.extend = function(props){
    var parent = this,child;
    child = function(){ 
        parent.apply(this, arguments);
    };                  
    child.parent=parent;  
    var FixConstructor = function(){
        this.constructor = child;
    };                  
    FixConstructor.prototype = parent.prototype;
    child.prototype = new FixConstructor();
    _.extend(child, parent);
    _.extend(child.prototype,props);
    return child;       
};                      



    

  1. the mighty basic View
    2. 




_.extend(View.prototype, {
    el:$("body"),         
    templateEngine: nunjucks,
    template:"",          
    data:"",              
    events:"click body:", 
    initialize:function(){
    },                    
    getData:function(options){
        if (!this.data) return Q();
        var methodAndUrl = this.data.split('@');
        return Q($.ajax(_.extend({
            url:methodAndUrl[1],
            method:methodAndUrl[0]
        },options)));       
    },                    
    render:function(){    
        var self = this;    
        return this.getData(this.dataOptions).then(function(data){
            self.el.html(self.templateEngine.render(self.template, {data:data}));
        }).then(self.bindEvent.bind(self));
    },                    
    bindEvent:function(){ 
        var self = this;    
        var events = _.result(this, 'events');
        if (!events) return this;
        _.each(_(events).keys(),function(key){
            var match = key.match(delegateEventSplitter);
            var eventName = match[1], selector = match[2];
            if (selector==''){
                self.el.on(eventName, _.bind(self[events[key]],self));
            } else{           
                self.el.find(selector).on(eventName, _.bind(self[events[key]],self));
            }                 

        });                 
    }                     
});                     



Why Router



as you may notice that when go to the detail page, you can't navigate back to blog list.



so basically, router can let us navigate around in single page app.




TASK 4



here is how we gonno use the router.



we should able new a Router, and register location to an action.



var router = new Router();

router.get("/", function(){
    header.render().then(bloglist.render.bind(bloglist));
});

router.get("/:gistid",function(params){
    new BlogDetailView('https://gitst.github.com/'+ params.gistid +".json").render();
});




you'll gonna implement this Router



once we have Router, we can remove the useless event



'click li a':"renderDetail"




Hint



    

  1. there are a window event listener call hashchange
    2. 

  2. you'll gonna like get help from regex
    3. 

  3. popstate will help you manage history go back and forward.
    4. 





Walkthrough



git checkout task.4



    

  1. regist what hash goes where
    2. 




router.get("/", function(){
    console.log("homepage");
    header.render();
    bloglist.render();
});



this is define of a rout, when receive / call the function which render header and blogist.



    

  1. implement the register
    2. 




Router.prototype.get = function(url,callback){
    var paramRegx = /:([^/.\\\\]+)/g;
    var param;
    var route = {
        paramNames:[],
        regex:'^'+ url +'$',
        params:{},
        callback:callback
    };
    while((param = paramRegx.exec(url))!==null){
        route.paramNames.push(param[1]);
        route.regex = route.regex.replace(param[0],"([^/.\\\\]+)").replace(":","");
    }
    this.routes.push(route);
};




we create a Router object which contain a list of routes, whenever get is called, regist the route as an route hash like



    var route = {
        paramNames:[],
        regex:'^'+ url +'$',
        params:{},
        callback:callback
    };




which contains a regex to match hash, paramname array, params dict, and a callback.



    

  1. then we need to listen to the hashchange, and find the route according to the hash.
    2. 




$(window).on("hashchange",function(e){
findRoute(e);
}



    

  1. what the findRoute actually do
    2. 




_.each(self.routes,function(route){
            var regex = new RegExp(route.regex,"g");
            if((values = regex.exec(hash))!==null){
                console.log(values);
                values.shift();
                route.callback(_.object(route.paramNames,values));
                return;
            }



findRoute need to iterate routes we registed before, find the one who match the hash loaction, then call it's callback.


Currently we put all our job into View, like define where to fetch data, fetch and operate on data, which is not good and should be done by Model.




TASK 5



extract Model out of View.




Hint



better use Q.defer to define your data which need to wait.

entry.title: Y åˆ†é’Ÿå­¦ Julia
entry.content:
# å•è¡Œæ³¨é‡Šåªéœ€è¦ä¸€ä¸ªäº•å·
#= å¤šè¡Œæ³¨é‡Š
   åªéœ€è¦ä»¥ '#=' å¼€å§‹ '=#' ç»“æŸ
   è¿˜å¯ä»¥åµŒå¥—.
=#

####################################################
## 1. åŸå§‹ç±»å‹ä¸æ“ä½œç¬¦
####################################################

# Julia ä¸­ä¸€åˆ‡çš†æ˜¯è¡¨è¾¾å¼ã€‚

# è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€äº›åŸºæœ¬æ•°å­—ç±»å‹.
3 # => 3 (Int64)
3.2 # => 3.2 (Float64)
2 + 1im # => 2 + 1im (Complex{Int64})
2//3 # => 2//3 (Rational{Int64})

# æ”¯æŒæ‰€æœ‰çš„æ™®é€šä¸­ç¼€æ“ä½œç¬¦ã€‚
1 + 1 # => 2
8 - 1 # => 7
10 * 2 # => 20
35 / 5 # => 7.0
5 / 2 # => 2.5 # ç”¨ Int é™¤ Int æ°¸è¿œè¿”å› Float
div(5, 2) # => 2 # ä½¿ç”¨ div æˆªæ–­å°æ•°ç‚¹
5 \ 35 # => 7.0
2 ^ 2 # => 4 # æ¬¡æ–¹, ä¸æ˜¯äºŒè¿›åˆ¶ xor
12 % 10 # => 2

# ç”¨æ‹¬å·æé«˜ä¼˜å…ˆçº§
(1 + 3) * 2 # => 8

# äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ“ä½œç¬¦
~2 # => -3   # é
3 & 5 # => 1 # ä¸
2 | 4 # => 6 # æˆ–
2 $ 4 # => 6 # å¼‚æˆ–
2 >>> 1 # => 1 # é€»è¾‘å³ç§»
2 >> 1  # => 1 # ç®—æœ¯å³ç§»
2 << 1  # => 4 # é€»è¾‘/ç®—æœ¯ å³ç§»

# å¯ä»¥ç”¨å‡½æ•° bits æŸ¥çœ‹äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ•°ã€‚
bits(12345)
# => "0000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000011000000111001"
bits(12345.0)
# => "0100000011001000000111001000000000000000000000000000000000000000"

# å¸ƒå°”å€¼æ˜¯åŸå§‹ç±»å‹
true
false

# å¸ƒå°”æ“ä½œç¬¦
!true # => false
!false # => true
1 == 1 # => true
2 == 1 # => false
1 != 1 # => false
2 != 1 # => true
1 < 10 # => true
1 > 10 # => false
2 <= 2 # => true
2 >= 2 # => true
# æ¯”è¾ƒå¯ä»¥ä¸²è”
1 < 2 < 3 # => true
2 < 3 < 2 # => false

# å­—ç¬¦ä¸²å¯ä»¥ç”± " åˆ›å»º
"This is a string."

# å­—ç¬¦å­—é¢é‡å¯ç”¨ ' åˆ›å»º
'a'

# å¯ä»¥åƒå–æ•°ç»„å–å€¼ä¸€æ ·ç”¨ index å–å‡ºå¯¹åº”å­—ç¬¦
"This is a string"[1] # => 'T' # Julia çš„ index ä» 1 å¼€å§‹ :(
# ä½†æ˜¯å¯¹ UTF-8 æ— æ•ˆ,
# å› æ­¤å»ºè®®ä½¿ç”¨éå†å™¨ (map, for loops, ç­‰).

# $ å¯ç”¨äºå­—ç¬¦æ’å€¼:
"2 + 2 = $(2 + 2)" # => "2 + 2 = 4"
# å¯ä»¥å°†ä»»ä½• Julia è¡¨è¾¾å¼æ”¾å…¥æ‹¬å·ã€‚

# å¦ä¸€ç§æ ¼å¼åŒ–å­—ç¬¦ä¸²çš„æ–¹å¼æ˜¯ printf å®.
@printf "%d is less than %f" 4.5 5.3 # 5 is less than 5.300000

# æ‰“å°å­—ç¬¦ä¸²å¾ˆå®¹æ˜“
println("I'm Julia. Nice to meet you!")

####################################################
## 2. å˜é‡ä¸é›†åˆ
####################################################

# ç»™å˜é‡èµ‹å€¼å°±æ˜¯å£°æ˜å˜é‡
some_var = 5 # => 5
some_var # => 5

# è®¿é—®æœªå£°æ˜å˜é‡ä¼šæŠ›å‡ºå¼‚å¸¸
try
    some_other_var # => ERROR: some_other_var not defined
catch e
    println(e)
end

# å˜é‡åéœ€è¦ä»¥å­—æ¯å¼€å¤´.
# ä¹‹åä»»ä½•å­—æ¯ï¼Œæ•°å­—ï¼Œä¸‹åˆ’çº¿ï¼Œå¹å·éƒ½æ˜¯åˆæ³•çš„ã€‚
SomeOtherVar123! = 6 # => 6

# ç”šè‡³å¯ä»¥ç”¨ unicode å­—ç¬¦
â˜ƒ = 8 # => 8
# ç”¨æ•°å­¦ç¬¦å·éå¸¸æ–¹ä¾¿
2 * Ï€ # => 6.283185307179586

# æ³¨æ„ Julia çš„å‘½åè§„çº¦:
#
# * å˜é‡åä¸ºå°å†™ï¼Œå•è¯ä¹‹é—´ä»¥ä¸‹åˆ’çº¿è¿æ¥('\_')ã€‚
#
# * ç±»å‹åä»¥å¤§å†™å­—æ¯å¼€å¤´ï¼Œå•è¯ä»¥ CamelCase æ–¹å¼è¿æ¥ã€‚
#
# * å‡½æ•°ä¸å®çš„åå­—å°å†™ï¼Œæ— ä¸‹åˆ’çº¿ã€‚
#
# * ä¼šæ”¹å˜è¾“å…¥çš„å‡½æ•°åæœ«ä½ä¸º !ã€‚
#   è¿™ç±»å‡½æ•°æœ‰æ—¶è¢«ç§°ä¸º mutating functions æˆ– in-place functions.

# æ•°ç»„å­˜å‚¨ä¸€åˆ—å€¼ï¼Œindex ä» 1 å¼€å§‹ã€‚
a = Int64[] # => 0-element Int64 Array

# ä¸€ç»´æ•°ç»„å¯ä»¥ä»¥é€—å·åˆ†éš”å€¼çš„æ–¹å¼å£°æ˜ã€‚
b = [4, 5, 6] # => åŒ…å« 3 ä¸ª Int64 ç±»å‹å…ƒç´ çš„æ•°ç»„: [4, 5, 6]
b[1] # => 4
b[end] # => 6

# äºŒç»´æ•°ç»„ä»¥åˆ†å·åˆ†éš”ç»´åº¦ã€‚
matrix = [1 2; 3 4] # => 2x2 Int64 æ•°ç»„: [1 2; 3 4]

# ä½¿ç”¨ push! å’Œ append! å¾€æ•°ç»„æœ«å°¾æ·»åŠ å…ƒç´ 
push!(a,1)     # => [1]
push!(a,2)     # => [1,2]
push!(a,4)     # => [1,2,4]
push!(a,3)     # => [1,2,4,3]
append!(a,b) # => [1,2,4,3,4,5,6]

# ç”¨ pop å¼¹å‡ºæœ«å°¾å…ƒç´ 
pop!(b)        # => 6 and b is now [4,5]

# å¯ä»¥å†æ”¾å›å»
push!(b,6)   # b åˆå˜æˆäº† [4,5,6].

a[1] # => 1 #  æ°¸è¿œè®°ä½ Julia çš„ index ä» 1 å¼€å§‹!

# ç”¨ end å¯ä»¥ç›´æ¥å–åˆ°æœ€åç´¢å¼•. å¯ç”¨ä½œä»»ä½•ç´¢å¼•è¡¨è¾¾å¼
a[end] # => 6

# è¿˜æ”¯æŒ shift å’Œ unshift
shift!(a) # => è¿”å› 1ï¼Œè€Œ a ç°åœ¨æ—¶ [2,4,3,4,5,6]
unshift!(a,7) # => [7,2,4,3,4,5,6]

# ä»¥å¹å·ç»“å°¾çš„å‡½æ•°åè¡¨ç¤ºå®ƒä¼šæ”¹å˜å‚æ•°çš„å€¼
arr = [5,4,6] # => åŒ…å«ä¸‰ä¸ª Int64 å…ƒç´ çš„æ•°ç»„: [5,4,6]
sort(arr) # => [4,5,6]; arr è¿˜æ˜¯ [5,4,6]
sort!(arr) # => [4,5,6]; arr ç°åœ¨æ˜¯ [4,5,6]

# è¶Šç•Œä¼šæŠ›å‡º BoundsError å¼‚å¸¸
try
    a[0] # => ERROR: BoundsError() in getindex at array.jl:270
    a[end+1] # => ERROR: BoundsError() in getindex at array.jl:270
catch e
    println(e)
end

# é”™è¯¯ä¼šæŒ‡å‡ºå‘ç”Ÿçš„è¡Œå·ï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬æ ‡å‡†åº“
# å¦‚æœä½ æœ‰ Julia æºä»£ç ï¼Œä½ å¯ä»¥æ‰¾åˆ°è¿™äº›åœ°æ–¹

# å¯ä»¥ç”¨ range åˆå§‹åŒ–æ•°ç»„
a = [1:5] # => 5-element Int64 Array: [1,2,3,4,5]

# å¯ä»¥åˆ‡å‰²æ•°ç»„
a[1:3] # => [1, 2, 3]
a[2:end] # => [2, 3, 4, 5]

# ç”¨ splice! åˆ‡å‰²åŸæ•°ç»„
arr = [3,4,5]
splice!(arr,2) # => 4 ; arr å˜æˆäº† [3,5]

# ç”¨ append! è¿æ¥æ•°ç»„
b = [1,2,3]
append!(a,b) # a å˜æˆäº† [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 1, 2, 3]

# æ£€æŸ¥å…ƒç´ æ˜¯å¦åœ¨æ•°ç»„ä¸­
in(1, a) # => true

# ç”¨ length è·å¾—æ•°ç»„é•¿åº¦
length(a) # => 8

# Tuples æ˜¯ immutable çš„
tup = (1, 2, 3) # => (1,2,3) # an (Int64,Int64,Int64) tuple.
tup[1] # => 1
try:
    tup[1] = 3 # => ERROR: no method setindex!((Int64,Int64,Int64),Int64,Int64)
catch e
    println(e)
end

# å¤§å¤šæ•°ç»„çš„å‡½æ•°åŒæ ·æ”¯æŒ tuples
length(tup) # => 3
tup[1:2] # => (1,2)
in(2, tup) # => true

# å¯ä»¥å°† tuples å…ƒç´ åˆ†åˆ«èµ‹ç»™å˜é‡
a, b, c = (1, 2, 3) # => (1,2,3)  # a is now 1, b is now 2 and c is now 3

# ä¸ç”¨æ‹¬å·ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥
d, e, f = 4, 5, 6 # => (4,5,6)

# å•å…ƒç´  tuple ä¸ç­‰äºå…¶å…ƒç´ å€¼
(1,) == 1 # => false
(1) == 1 # => true

# äº¤æ¢å€¼
e, d = d, e  # => (5,4) # d is now 5 and e is now 4


# å­—å…¸Dictionaries store mappings
empty_dict = Dict() # => Dict{Any,Any}()

# ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ç”¨å­—é¢é‡åˆ›å»ºå­—å…¸
filled_dict = ["one"=> 1, "two"=> 2, "three"=> 3]
# => Dict{ASCIIString,Int64}

# ç”¨ [] è·å¾—é”®å€¼
filled_dict["one"] # => 1

# è·å¾—æ‰€æœ‰é”®
keys(filled_dict)
# => KeyIterator{Dict{ASCIIString,Int64}}(["three"=>3,"one"=>1,"two"=>2])
# æ³¨æ„ï¼Œé”®çš„é¡ºåºä¸æ˜¯æ’å…¥æ—¶çš„é¡ºåº

# è·å¾—æ‰€æœ‰å€¼
values(filled_dict)
# => ValueIterator{Dict{ASCIIString,Int64}}(["three"=>3,"one"=>1,"two"=>2])
# æ³¨æ„ï¼Œå€¼çš„é¡ºåºä¹Ÿä¸€æ ·

# ç”¨ in æ£€æŸ¥é”®å€¼æ˜¯å¦å·²å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œç”¨ haskey æ£€æŸ¥é”®æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨
in(("one", 1), filled_dict) # => true
in(("two", 3), filled_dict) # => false
haskey(filled_dict, "one") # => true
haskey(filled_dict, 1) # => false

# è·å–ä¸å­˜åœ¨çš„é”®çš„å€¼ä¼šæŠ›å‡ºå¼‚å¸¸
try
    filled_dict["four"] # => ERROR: key not found: four in getindex at dict.jl:489
catch e
    println(e)
end

# ä½¿ç”¨ get å¯ä»¥æä¾›é»˜è®¤å€¼æ¥é¿å…å¼‚å¸¸
# get(dictionary,key,default_value)
get(filled_dict,"one",4) # => 1
get(filled_dict,"four",4) # => 4

# ç”¨ Sets è¡¨ç¤ºæ— åºä¸å¯é‡å¤çš„å€¼çš„é›†åˆ
empty_set = Set() # => Set{Any}()
# åˆå§‹åŒ–ä¸€ä¸ª Set å¹¶å®šä¹‰å…¶å€¼
filled_set = Set(1,2,2,3,4) # => Set{Int64}(1,2,3,4)

# æ·»åŠ å€¼
push!(filled_set,5) # => Set{Int64}(5,4,2,3,1)

# æ£€æŸ¥æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨æŸå€¼
in(2, filled_set) # => true
in(10, filled_set) # => false

# äº¤é›†ï¼Œå¹¶é›†ï¼Œå·®é›†
other_set = Set(3, 4, 5, 6) # => Set{Int64}(6,4,5,3)
intersect(filled_set, other_set) # => Set{Int64}(3,4,5)
union(filled_set, other_set) # => Set{Int64}(1,2,3,4,5,6)
setdiff(Set(1,2,3,4),Set(2,3,5)) # => Set{Int64}(1,4)

## 3. æ§åˆ¶æµ

# å£°æ˜ä¸€ä¸ªå˜é‡
some_var = 5

# è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ª if è¯­å¥ï¼Œç¼©è¿›ä¸æ˜¯å¿…è¦çš„
if some_var > 10
    println("some_var is totally bigger than 10.")
elseif some_var < 10    # elseif æ˜¯å¯é€‰çš„.
    println("some_var is smaller than 10.")
else                    # else ä¹Ÿæ˜¯å¯é€‰çš„.
    println("some_var is indeed 10.")
end
# => prints "some var is smaller than 10"


# For å¾ªç¯éå†
# Iterable ç±»å‹åŒ…æ‹¬ Range, Array, Set, Dict, ä»¥åŠ String.
for animal=["dog", "cat", "mouse"]
    println("$animal is a mammal")
    # å¯ç”¨ $ å°† variables æˆ– expression è½¬æ¢ä¸ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²into strings
end
# prints:
#    dog is a mammal
#    cat is a mammal
#    mouse is a mammal

# You can use 'in' instead of '='.
for animal in ["dog", "cat", "mouse"]
    println("$animal is a mammal")
end
# prints:
#    dog is a mammal
#    cat is a mammal
#    mouse is a mammal

for a in ["dog"=>"mammal","cat"=>"mammal","mouse"=>"mammal"]
    println("$(a[1]) is a $(a[2])")
end
# prints:
#    dog is a mammal
#    cat is a mammal
#    mouse is a mammal

for (k,v) in ["dog"=>"mammal","cat"=>"mammal","mouse"=>"mammal"]
    println("$k is a $v")
end
# prints:
#    dog is a mammal
#    cat is a mammal
#    mouse is a mammal

# While å¾ªç¯
x = 0
while x < 4
    println(x)
    x += 1  # x = x + 1
end
# prints:
#   0
#   1
#   2
#   3

# ç”¨ try/catch å¤„ç†å¼‚å¸¸
try
   error("help")

   println("caught it $e")
end
# => caught it ErrorException("help")

# ç”¨å…³é”®å­— 'function' å¯åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ–°å‡½æ•°

function add(x, y)

    x + y

add(5, 6) # => åœ¨ "x is 5 and y is 6" åä¼šæ‰“å° 11

# è¿˜å¯ä»¥å®šä¹‰æ¥æ”¶å¯å˜é•¿å‚æ•°çš„å‡½æ•°
function varargs(args...)
    return args
    # å…³é”®å­— return å¯åœ¨å‡½æ•°å†…éƒ¨ä»»ä½•åœ°æ–¹è¿”å›
end
# => varargs (generic function with 1 method)

varargs(1,2,3) # => (1,2,3)

# çœç•¥å· ... è¢«ç§°ä¸º splat.
# åˆšåˆšç”¨åœ¨äº†å‡½æ•°å®šä¹‰ä¸­
# è¿˜å¯ä»¥ç”¨åœ¨å‡½æ•°çš„è°ƒç”¨
# Array æˆ–è€… Tuple çš„å†…å®¹ä¼šå˜æˆå‚æ•°åˆ—è¡¨
Set([1,2,3])    # => Set{Array{Int64,1}}([1,2,3]) # è·å¾—ä¸€ä¸ª Array çš„ Set

x = (1,2,3)     # => (1,2,3)

# å¯å®šä¹‰å¯é€‰å‚æ•°çš„å‡½æ•°
function defaults(a,b,x=5,y=6)
    return "$a $b and $x $y"
end

defaults('h','g') # => "h g and 5 6"
defaults('h','g','j') # => "h g and j 6"
defaults('h','g','j','k') # => "h g and j k"
try
    defaults('h') # => ERROR: no method defaults(Char,)
    defaults() # => ERROR: no methods defaults()
catch e
    println(e)
end

# è¿˜å¯ä»¥å®šä¹‰é”®å€¼å¯¹çš„å‚æ•°
function keyword_args(;k1=4,name2="hello") # note the ;
    return ["k1"=>k1,"name2"=>name2]
end

keyword_args(name2="ness") # => ["name2"=>"ness","k1"=>4]
keyword_args(k1="mine") # => ["k1"=>"mine","name2"=>"hello"]
keyword_args() # => ["name2"=>"hello","k1"=>4]

# å¯ä»¥ç»„åˆå„ç§ç±»å‹çš„å‚æ•°åœ¨åŒä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°çš„å‚æ•°åˆ—è¡¨ä¸­
function all_the_args(normal_arg, optional_positional_arg=2; keyword_arg="foo")
    println("normal arg: $normal_arg")
    println("optional arg: $optional_positional_arg")
    println("keyword arg: $keyword_arg")
end

all_the_args(1, 3, keyword_arg=4)
# prints:
#   normal arg: 1
#   optional arg: 3
#   keyword arg: 4

# Julia æœ‰ä¸€ç­‰å‡½æ•°
function create_adder(x)
    adder = function (y)
        return x + y
    end
    return adder
end

# è¿™æ˜¯ç”¨ "stabby lambda syntax" åˆ›å»ºçš„åŒ¿åå‡½æ•°
(x -> x > 2)(3) # => true

# è¿™ä¸ªå‡½æ•°å’Œä¸Šé¢çš„ create_adder ä¸€æ¨¡ä¸€æ ·
function create_adder(x)
    y -> x + y
end

# ä½ ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ç»™å†…éƒ¨å‡½æ•°èµ·ä¸ªåå­—
function create_adder(x)
    function adder(y)
        x + y
    end
    adder
end

add_10 = create_adder(10)
add_10(3) # => 13


# å†…ç½®çš„é«˜é˜¶å‡½æ•°æœ‰
map(add_10, [1,2,3]) # => [11, 12, 13]
filter(x -> x > 5, [3, 4, 5, 6, 7]) # => [6, 7]

# è¿˜å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ list comprehensions æ›¿ä»£ map
[add_10(i) for i=[1, 2, 3]] # => [11, 12, 13]
[add_10(i) for i in [1, 2, 3]] # => [11, 12, 13]

# Julia æœ‰ç±»å‹ç³»ç»Ÿ
# æ‰€æœ‰çš„å€¼éƒ½æœ‰ç±»å‹ï¼›ä½†å˜é‡æœ¬èº«æ²¡æœ‰ç±»å‹
# ä½ å¯ä»¥ç”¨ `typeof` å‡½æ•°è·å¾—å€¼çš„ç±»å‹
typeof(5) # => Int64

# ç±»å‹æ˜¯ä¸€ç­‰å€¼
typeof(Int64) # => DataType
typeof(DataType) # => DataType
# DataType æ˜¯ä»£è¡¨ç±»å‹çš„ç±»å‹ï¼Œä¹Ÿä»£è¡¨ä»–è‡ªå·±çš„ç±»å‹

# ç±»å‹å¯ç”¨ä½œæ–‡æ¡£åŒ–ï¼Œä¼˜åŒ–ï¼Œä»¥åŠè°ƒåº¦
# å¹¶ä¸æ˜¯é™æ€æ£€æŸ¥ç±»å‹

# ç”¨æˆ·è¿˜å¯ä»¥è‡ªå®šä¹‰ç±»å‹
# è·Ÿå…¶ä»–è¯­è¨€çš„ records æˆ– structs ä¸€æ ·
# ç”¨ `type` å…³é”®å­—å®šä¹‰æ–°çš„ç±»å‹

# type Name
#   field::OptionalType
#   ...
# end
type Tiger
  taillength::Float64
  coatcolor # ä¸é™„å¸¦ç±»å‹æ ‡æ³¨çš„ç›¸å½“äº `::Any`
end

# æ„é€ å‡½æ•°å‚æ•°æ˜¯ç±»å‹çš„å±æ€§
tigger = Tiger(3.5,"orange") # => Tiger(3.5,"orange")

# ç”¨æ–°ç±»å‹ä½œä¸ºæ„é€ å‡½æ•°è¿˜ä¼šåˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªç±»å‹
sherekhan = typeof(tigger)(5.6,"fire") # => Tiger(5.6,"fire")

# struct ç±»ä¼¼çš„ç±»å‹è¢«ç§°ä¸ºå…·ä½“ç±»å‹
# ä»–ä»¬å¯è¢«å®ä¾‹åŒ–ä½†ä¸èƒ½æœ‰å­ç±»å‹
# å¦ä¸€ç§ç±»å‹æ˜¯æŠ½è±¡ç±»å‹

# abstract Name
abstract Cat # just a name and point in the type hierarchy

# æŠ½è±¡ç±»å‹ä¸èƒ½è¢«å®ä¾‹åŒ–ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¯ä»¥æœ‰å­ç±»å‹
# ä¾‹å¦‚ï¼ŒNumber å°±æ˜¯æŠ½è±¡ç±»å‹
subtypes(Number) # => 6-element Array{Any,1}:
                 #     Complex{Float16}
                 #     Complex{Float32}
                 #     Complex{Float64}
                 #     Complex{T<:Real}
                 #     ImaginaryUnit
                 #     Real
subtypes(Cat) # => 0-element Array{Any,1}

# æ‰€æœ‰çš„ç±»å‹éƒ½æœ‰çˆ¶ç±»å‹; å¯ä»¥ç”¨å‡½æ•° `super` å¾—åˆ°çˆ¶ç±»å‹.
typeof(5) # => Int64
super(Int64) # => Signed
super(Signed) # => Real
super(Real) # => Number
super(Number) # => Any
super(super(Signed)) # => Number
super(Any) # => Any
# æ‰€æœ‰è¿™äº›ç±»å‹ï¼Œé™¤äº† Int64, éƒ½æ˜¯æŠ½è±¡ç±»å‹.

# <: æ˜¯ç±»å‹é›†æˆæ“ä½œç¬¦
type Lion <: Cat # Lion æ˜¯ Cat çš„å­ç±»å‹
  mane_color
  roar::String
end

# å¯ä»¥ç»§ç»­ä¸ºä½ çš„ç±»å‹å®šä¹‰æ„é€ å‡½æ•°
# åªéœ€è¦å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªåŒåçš„å‡½æ•°
# å¹¶è°ƒç”¨å·²æœ‰çš„æ„é€ å‡½æ•°è®¾ç½®ä¸€ä¸ªå›ºå®šå‚æ•°
Lion(roar::String) = Lion("green",roar)
# è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå¤–éƒ¨æ„é€ å‡½æ•°ï¼Œå› ä¸ºä»–å†ç±»å‹å®šä¹‰ä¹‹å¤–

type Panther <: Cat # Panther ä¹Ÿæ˜¯ Cat çš„å­ç±»å‹
  eye_color
  Panther() = new("green")
  # Panthers åªæœ‰è¿™ä¸ªæ„é€ å‡½æ•°ï¼Œæ²¡æœ‰é»˜è®¤æ„é€ å‡½æ•°
end
# ä½¿ç”¨å†…ç½®æ„é€ å‡½æ•°ï¼Œå¦‚ Pantherï¼Œå¯ä»¥è®©ä½ æ§åˆ¶
# å¦‚ä½•æ„é€ ç±»å‹çš„å€¼
# åº”è¯¥å°½å¯èƒ½ä½¿ç”¨å¤–éƒ¨æ„é€ å‡½æ•°è€Œä¸æ˜¯å†…éƒ¨æ„é€ å‡½æ•°

# åœ¨Juliaä¸­, æ‰€æœ‰çš„å…·åå‡½æ•°éƒ½æ˜¯ç±»å±å‡½æ•°
# è¿™æ„å‘³ç€ä»–ä»¬éƒ½æ˜¯æœ‰å¾ˆå¤§å°æ–¹æ³•ç»„æˆçš„
# æ¯ä¸ª Lion çš„æ„é€ å‡½æ•°éƒ½æ˜¯ç±»å±å‡½æ•° Lion çš„æ–¹æ³•

# æˆ‘ä»¬æ¥çœ‹ä¸€ä¸ªéæ„é€ å‡½æ•°çš„ä¾‹å­

# Lion, Panther, Tiger çš„ meow å®šä¹‰ä¸º
function meow(animal::Lion)
  animal.roar # ä½¿ç”¨ç‚¹ç¬¦å·è®¿é—®å±æ€§
end

function meow(animal::Panther)
  "grrr"
end

function meow(animal::Tiger)
  "rawwwr"
end

# è¯•è¯• meow å‡½æ•°
meow(tigger) # => "rawwr"
meow(Lion("brown","ROAAR")) # => "ROAAR"
meow(Panther()) # => "grrr"

# å†çœ‹çœ‹å±‚æ¬¡ç»“æ„
issubtype(Tiger,Cat) # => false
issubtype(Lion,Cat) # => true
issubtype(Panther,Cat) # => true

# å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªæ¥æ”¶ Cats çš„å‡½æ•°
function pet_cat(cat::Cat)
  println("The cat says $(meow(cat))")
end

pet_cat(Lion("42")) # => prints "The cat says 42"
try
    pet_cat(tigger) # => ERROR: no method pet_cat(Tiger,)
catch e
    println(e)
end

# åœ¨é¢å‘å¯¹è±¡è¯­è¨€ä¸­ï¼Œé€šå¸¸éƒ½æ˜¯å•åˆ†æ´¾
# è¿™æ„å‘³ç€åˆ†æ´¾æ–¹æ³•æ˜¯é€šè¿‡ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°çš„ç±»å‹å†³å®šçš„
# åœ¨Juliaä¸­, æ‰€æœ‰å‚æ•°ç±»å‹éƒ½ä¼šè¢«è€ƒè™‘åˆ°

# è®©æˆ‘ä»¬å®šä¹‰æœ‰å¤šä¸ªå‚æ•°çš„å‡½æ•°ï¼Œå¥½çœ‹çœ‹åŒºåˆ«
function fight(t::Tiger,c::Cat)
  println("The $(t.coatcolor) tiger wins!")
end
# => fight (generic function with 1 method)

fight(tigger,Panther()) # => prints The orange tiger wins!
fight(tigger,Lion("ROAR")) # => prints The orange tiger wins!

# è®©æˆ‘ä»¬ä¿®æ”¹ä¸€ä¸‹ä¼ å…¥å…·ä½“ä¸º Lion ç±»å‹æ—¶çš„è¡Œä¸º
fight(t::Tiger,l::Lion) = println("The $(l.mane_color)-maned lion wins!")
# => fight (generic function with 2 methods)

fight(tigger,Panther()) # => prints The orange tiger wins!
fight(tigger,Lion("ROAR")) # => prints The green-maned lion wins!

# æŠŠ Tiger å»æ‰
fight(l::Lion,c::Cat) = println("The victorious cat says $(meow(c))")
# => fight (generic function with 3 methods)

fight(Lion("balooga!"),Panther()) # => prints The victorious cat says grrr
try
  fight(Panther(),Lion("RAWR")) # => ERROR: no method fight(Panther,Lion)
catch
end

# åœ¨è¯•è¯•è®© Cat åœ¨å‰é¢
fight(c::Cat,l::Lion) = println("The cat beats the Lion")
# => Warning: New definition
#    fight(Cat,Lion) at none:1
# is ambiguous with
#    fight(Lion,Cat) at none:2.
# Make sure
#    fight(Lion,Lion)
# is defined first.
#fight (generic function with 4 methods)

# è­¦å‘Šè¯´æ˜äº†æ— æ³•åˆ¤æ–­ä½¿ç”¨å“ªä¸ª fight æ–¹æ³•
fight(Lion("RAR"),Lion("brown","rarrr")) # => prints The victorious cat says rarrr
# ç»“æœåœ¨è€ç‰ˆæœ¬ Julia ä¸­å¯èƒ½ä¼šä¸ä¸€æ ·

fight(l::Lion,l2::Lion) = println("The lions come to a tie")
fight(Lion("RAR"),Lion("brown","rarrr")) # => prints The lions come to a tie


# Under the hood
# ä½ è¿˜å¯ä»¥çœ‹çœ‹ llvm ä»¥åŠç”Ÿæˆçš„æ±‡ç¼–ä»£ç 

square_area(l) = l * l      # square_area (generic function with 1 method)

square_area(5) #25

# ç»™ square_area ä¸€ä¸ªæ•´å½¢æ—¶å‘ç”Ÿä»€ä¹ˆ
code_native(square_area, (Int32,))
    #       .section    __TEXT,__text,regular,pure_instructions
    #   Filename: none
    #   Source line: 1              # Prologue
    #       push    RBP
    #       mov RBP, RSP
    #   Source line: 1
    #       movsxd  RAX, EDI        # Fetch l from memory?
    #       imul    RAX, RAX        # Square l and store the result in RAX
    #       pop RBP                 # Restore old base pointer
    #       ret                     # Result will still be in RAX

code_native(square_area, (Float32,))
    #       .section    __TEXT,__text,regular,pure_instructions
    #   Filename: none
    #   Source line: 1
    #       push    RBP
    #       mov RBP, RSP
    #   Source line: 1
    #       vmulss  XMM0, XMM0, XMM0  # Scalar single precision multiply (AVX)
    #       pop RBP
    #       ret

code_native(square_area, (Float64,))
    #       .section    __TEXT,__text,regular,pure_instructions
    #   Filename: none
    #   Source line: 1
    #       push    RBP
    #       mov RBP, RSP
    #   Source line: 1
    #       vmulsd  XMM0, XMM0, XMM0 # Scalar double precision multiply (AVX)
    #       pop RBP
    #       ret
    #
# æ³¨æ„ åªè¦å‚æ•°ä¸­åˆæµ®ç‚¹ç±»å‹ï¼ŒJulia å°±ä½¿ç”¨æµ®ç‚¹æŒ‡ä»¤
# è®©æˆ‘ä»¬è®¡ç®—ä¸€ä¸‹åœ†çš„é¢ç§¯
circle_area(r) = pi * r * r     # circle_area (generic function with 1 method)
circle_area(5)                  # 78.53981633974483

code_native(circle_area, (Int32,))
    #       .section    __TEXT,__text,regular,pure_instructions
    #   Filename: none
    #   Source line: 1
    #       push    RBP
    #       mov RBP, RSP
    #   Source line: 1
    #       vcvtsi2sd   XMM0, XMM0, EDI          # Load integer (r) from memory
    #       movabs  RAX, 4593140240              # Load pi
    #       vmulsd  XMM1, XMM0, QWORD PTR [RAX]  # pi * r
    #       vmulsd  XMM0, XMM0, XMM1             # (pi * r) * r
    #       pop RBP
    #       ret
    #

code_native(circle_area, (Float64,))

    #       pop RBP

ä½¿ç”¨ç‚¹ç¬¦å·è®¿é—®å±æ€§", "end", "", "function meow(animal::Panther)", "  "grrr"", "end", "", "function meow(animal::Tiger)", "  "rawwwr"", "end", "", "# è¯•è¯• meow å‡½æ•°", "meow(tigger) # => "rawwr"", "meow(Lion("brown","ROAAR")) # => prints The orange tiger wins!", "fight(tigger,Lion("ROAR")) # => prints The orange tiger wins!", "", "# è®©æˆ‘ä»¬ä¿®æ”¹ä¸€ä¸‹ä¼ å…¥å…·ä½“ä¸º Lion ç±»å‹æ—¶çš„è¡Œä¸º", "fight(t::Tiger,l::Lion) = println("The $(l.mane_color)-maned lion wins!")", "# => fight (generic function with 2 methods)", "", "fight(tigger,Panther()) # => prints The orange tiger wins!", "fight(tigger,Lion("ROAR")) # => prints The green-maned lion wins!", "", "# æŠŠ Tiger å»æ‰", "fight(l::Lion,c::Cat) = println("The victorious cat says $(meow(c))")", "# => fight (generic function with 3 methods)", "", "fight(Lion("balooga!"),Panther()) # => prints The victorious cat says grrr", "try", "  fight(Panther(),Lion("RAWR")) # => ERROR: no method fight(Panther,Lion)", "catch", "end", "", "# åœ¨è¯•è¯•è®© Cat åœ¨å‰é¢", "fight(c::Cat,l::Lion) = println("The cat beats the Lion")", "# => Warning: New definition", "#    fight(Cat,Lion) at none:1", "# is ambiguous with", "#    fight(Lion,Cat) at none:2.", "# Make sure", "#    fight(Lion,Lion)", "# is defined first.", "#fight (generic function with 4 methods)", "", "# è­¦å‘Šè¯´æ˜äº†æ— æ³•åˆ¤æ–­ä½¿ç”¨å“ªä¸ª fight æ–¹æ³•", "fight(Lion("RAR"),Lion("brown","rarrr")) # => prints The victorious cat says rarrr", "# ç»“æœåœ¨è€ç‰ˆæœ¬ Julia ä¸­å¯èƒ½ä¼šä¸ä¸€æ ·", "", "fight(l::Lion,l2::Lion) = println("The lions come to a tie")", "fight(Lion("RAR"),Lion("brown","rarrr")) # => prints The lions come to a tie", "", "", "# Under the hood", "# ä½ è¿˜å¯ä»¥çœ‹çœ‹ llvm ä»¥åŠç”Ÿæˆçš„æ±‡ç¼–ä»£ç ", "", "square_area(l) = l * l      # square_area (generic function with 1 method)", "", "square_area(5) #25", "", "# ç»™ square_area ä¸€ä¸ªæ•´å½¢æ—¶å‘ç”Ÿä»€ä¹ˆ", "code_native(square_area, (Int32,))", "    # entry.title: flash dd-wrt and install transmission in WNR2200 router
entry.content:
Prepaire



    

  • USB disk
æ ¼å¼åŒ–æˆext2/3æ ¼å¼, with gparted in linux. æ ¹æ®å®˜æ–¹wiki, æœ€æ–°çš„v24å·²ç»
ä¸ç”¨jffsäº†, ç›®å‰çš„dd-wrtç›®å½•ç»“æ„æ˜¯è¿™æ ·çš„:
    • 




/tmp ## mounted on the RAM drive of dd-wrt
/jffs  ## builti-in flash, å·²ç»disable
/mnt ## used for rw drive




å› æ­¤æ ¹æ®éœ€è¦æ ¼å¼åŒ–, å¦‚æœä½ çš„ç¡¬ç›˜ä¸€ç›´è¦ä¸è·¯ç”±è¿, æˆ–è€…éœ€è¦åœ¨ç¡¬ç›˜ä¸Šè£…è½¯ä»¶
, å°±æ ¼æˆext3,å¦‚æœåªæ˜¯å­˜å‚¨æ•°æ®, whatever, fatä¹Ÿå¯ç”¨





Use ONLY ext2/3 for partition/drives that you plan for permanent connection to your DD-WRT box, or for drives where you plan to install additional software packages onto (like optware, Samba, Torrent etc.). You can use any of the three mount points: /opt, /mnt, /jffs



Use FAT32 on data partitions if you intend to connect this drive to other systems (MAC, Windows) to copy files from/to directly. You should use the mount point: /mnt 





wikiå»ºè®®è¿è·¯ç”±ä¸“ç”¨çš„ç¡¬ç›˜å¯ç”¨æ ¼å¼æˆè¿™æ ·



    one: for optware packages - make it 32MB - 2GB - use ext2/3 as the format
    two: for swap file - make it 16-256 MB - format it as linux swap file
    three: for data space - make it fit the rest of the disk - use ext2/3 or FAT32 as the format
    four: for jffs space - make it 32MB - 2GB - use ext2/3 as the format 




    

  • Connection
ä½ éœ€è¦ç”¨sshæˆ–è€…telnetè¿æ¥routeræ¥å®‰è£…è½¯ä»¶
<!-- more -->
# Installation #
    • 

  • mount your usb
Under Services->USB:
     * Enable Core USB Support
     *  Disable USB Printer Support (enable it if you need printing support)
     * Enable USB Storage Support
     * Enable Automatic Drive Mount
     * Set Disk Mount Point to /mnt
     * Click Apply Settings 
    • 

  • make sure mount it to /mnt
æˆ‘çš„usbè¯»å¡å™¨mountåˆ°äº†/mnt/sda_part1ä¸Š, éœ€è¦å†æ‰‹åŠ¨mountåˆ°mntç›®å½•ä¸‹
    • 

  • mount some directions 
    • 




cd /mnt
mkdir etc opt root
touch optware.enable
chmod 755 etc opt root
mkdir opt/lib
chmod 755 opt/lib
cp -a /etc/* /mnt/etc/
mount -o bind /mnt/etc /etc
mount -o bind /mnt/opt /jffs 



    

  • install opkg and libc
    • 




wget http://downloads.openwrt.org/backfire/10.03.1/ar71xx/packages/opkg_576-2_ar71xx.ipk
ipkg install libc_0.9.30.1-43.32_ar71xx.ipk 
wget http://downloads.openwrt.org/snapshots/trunk/ar71xx/packages/libc_0.9.33.2-1_ar71xx.ipk
opkg install libc_0.9.33.2-1_ar71xx.ipk



    

  • Type the following lines to create the configuration file for opkg:
    • 




cat > /etc/opkg.conf << EOF
src/gz snapshots http://downloads.openwrt.org/snapshots/trunk/ar71xx/packages
dest root /opt
dest ram /opt/tmp
lists_dir ext /opt/tmp/var/opkg-lists
EOF 



    

  • Make sure opkg is ok
    • 




umount /jffs
mount -o bind /mnt/root /tmp/root
mount -o bind /mnt/opt /opt
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH='/opt/lib:/opt/usr/lib:/lib:/usr/lib'
opkg update 



    

  • now you can install transmission
    • 




opkg install transmission-daemon transmission-web



    

  • Finally change the transmission-web PATH
transmission-web çš„index.htmlæ–‡ä»¶éƒ½åœ¨
/opt/usr/share/transmission/web/ä¸‹, è€Œé»˜è®¤transmissionä¼šåˆ°/tmp/ä¸‹
æ‰¾,  å› æ­¤éœ€è¦linkä¸‹
  ln -s /opt/usr/share/transmission/web/ /tmp/root/.local/share/transmission/web
    • 





Configure



    

  • start daemon first
transmission-daemon -g /mnt/data/torrents/.config/transmission-daemon
killall transmission-daemon
    • 

  • edit setting.json
vi /mnt/data/torrents/.config/transmission-daemon/settings.js
ç¼–è¾‘ç¡®ä¿è·Ÿå¦‚ä¸‹å‡ è¡Œä¸€æ ·
    • 




  {
     "blocklist-enabled": 1,
     "download-dir": "\/mnt\/data\/torrents",
     "download-limit": 100,
     "download-limit-enabled": 1,
     "encryption": 2,
     "max-peers-global": 35,
     "peer-port": 25000,
     "pex-enabled": 1,
     "port-forwarding-enabled": 1,
     "rpc-authentication-required": 0,
     "rpc-password": "",
     "rpc-port": 9091,
     "rpc-username": "",
     "rpc-whitelist": "192.168.1.*",
     "upload-limit": 200,
     "upload-limit-enabled": 1
     }



    

  • Restart and rock
    • 




killall transmission-daemon
transmission-daemon -g /mnt/data/torrents/.config/transmission-daemon



and also, you can enable WAN
access



iptables -I INPUT 1 -p tcp --dport 25000 -j logaccept



è¿™æ ·å°±å¯ä»¥è¿œç¨‹è®¿é—®transmissionäº†

entry.content:
æœ¬æ–‡åŸºæœ¬ä¸Šè¿™ä¸ºä¸¤ç¯‡æ–‡ç« çš„ç¿»è¯‘å’Œæ•´åˆ --
  Scalable networking And
  Why are event-driven server so great






OPPCæ¨¡å‹ç“¶é¢ˆ



ä¼ ç»ŸæœåŠ¡å™¨æ¨¡å‹å¦‚Apacheä¸ºæ¯ä¸€ä¸ªè¯·æ±‚ç”Ÿæˆä¸€ä¸ªå­è¿›ç¨‹ã€‚å½“ç”¨æˆ·è¿æ¥åˆ°æœåŠ¡å™¨çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå­è¿›ç¨‹å°±äº§ç”Ÿï¼Œå¹¶å¤„ç†è¿æ¥ã€‚æ¯ä¸ªè¿æ¥è·å¾—ä¸€ä¸ªå•ç‹¬çš„çº¿ç¨‹å’Œå­è¿›ç¨‹ã€‚å½“ç”¨æˆ·è¯·æ±‚æ•°æ®è¿”å›æ—¶ï¼Œå­è¿›ç¨‹å¼€å§‹ç­‰å¾…æ•°æ®åº“æ“ä½œè¿”å›ã€‚å¦‚æœæ­¤æ—¶å¦ä¸€ä¸ªç”¨æˆ·ä¹Ÿè¯·æ±‚è¿”å›æ•°æ®ï¼Œè¿™æ—¶å°±äº§ç”Ÿäº†é˜»å¡ã€‚



è¿™ç§æ¨¡å¼åœ¨éå¸¸å°çš„å·¥ä½œè´Ÿè·æ˜¯è¡¨ç°è‰¯å¥½ï¼Œå½“è¯·æ±‚çš„æ•°é‡å˜å¾—å¤ªå¤§æ˜¯æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¼šå‹åŠ›è¿‡äºå·¨å¤§ã€‚ å½“Apacheè¾¾åˆ°è¿›ç¨‹çš„æœ€å¤§æ•°é‡ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰è¿›ç¨‹éƒ½å˜å¾—ç¼“æ…¢ã€‚æ¯ä¸ªè¯·æ±‚éƒ½æœ‰è‡ªå·±çš„çº¿ç¨‹ï¼Œå¦‚æœæœåŠ¡ä»£ç ä½¿ç”¨PHPç¼–å†™æ—¶ï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹æ‰€éœ€è¦çš„å†…å­˜é‡æ˜¯ç›¸å½“å¤§çš„[1]ã€‚




fork()æ“ä½œå»¶æ—¶



äº‹å®ä¸Šï¼ŒåŸºäºOPPCçš„ç½‘ç»œå¹¶ä¸å¦‚æƒ³è±¡ä¸­çš„é«˜æ•ˆã€‚é¦–å…ˆæ–°å»ºè¿›ç¨‹çš„æ€§èƒ½å¾ˆå¤§ç¨‹åº¦ä¸Šä¾èµ–äºæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿå¯¹fork()çš„å®ç°ï¼Œç„¶è€Œä¸åŒæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿçš„å¤„ç†å¹¶ééƒ½ç†æƒ³ã€‚å¦‚å›¾ä¸ºå„æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿfork()çš„å»¶è¿Ÿæ—¶é—´å¯¹æ¯”ã€‚



æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿforkæ“ä½œåªæ˜¯ç®€å•çš„æ‹·è´åˆ†é¡µæ˜ å°„ã€‚åŠ¨æ€é“¾æ¥ä¸ºå…±äº«åº“å’Œå…¨å±€åç§»è¡¨ä¸­çš„ELFï¼ˆExecutable and Linking Formatï¼‰éƒ¨åˆ†åˆ›å»ºå¤ªå¤šçš„åˆ†é¡µæ˜ å°„ã€‚è™½ç„¶é™æ€çš„é“¾æ¥forkä¼šæ˜¯çš„æ€§èƒ½å¤§å¹…åº¦æå‡ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å»¶æ—¶ä¾ç„¶ä¸ä¹è§‚ã€‚




å›¾ 1 forkå»¶æ—¶




è¿›ç¨‹è°ƒåº¦



Linuxæ¯10æ¯«ç§’ï¼ˆAlphaæ˜¯1æ¯«ç§’ï¼Œè¯¥å€¼ä¸ºå·²ç¼–è¯‘å¸¸é‡ï¼‰ä¸­æ–­ä¸€æ¬¡åœ¨è¿è¡Œæ€çš„è¿›ç¨‹ï¼ŒæŸ¥çœ‹æ˜¯å¦è¦åˆ‡æ¢åˆ«çš„è¿›ç¨‹æ‰§è¡Œã€‚è¿›ç¨‹è°ƒåº¦çš„ä»»åŠ¡å°±æ˜¯å†³å®šä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªåº”è¯¥æ‰§è¡Œçš„è¿›ç¨‹ï¼Œè€Œå…¶éš¾åº¦å°±åœ¨äºå¦‚ä½•å…¬å¹³çš„åˆ†é…CPUèµ„æºã€‚ä¸€ä¸ªå¥½çš„è°ƒåº¦ç®—æ³•åº”è¯¥ç»™æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹éƒ½åˆ†äº«å…¬å¹³çš„CPUèµ„æºï¼Œè€Œä¸”ä¸åº”è¯¥å‡ºç°é¥¥é¥¿è¿›ç¨‹ã€‚





Unixç³»ç»Ÿé‡‡ç”¨å¤šçº§åé¦ˆé˜Ÿåˆ—è°ƒåº¦ç®—æ³•ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨å¤šä¸ªä¸åŒä¼˜å…ˆçº§çš„å°±ç»ªé˜Ÿåˆ—ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨Heapä¿æŒé˜Ÿåˆ—æŒ‰ä¼˜å…ˆçº§é¡ºåºæ’åºã€‚Linux 2.6ç‰ˆæœ¬æä¾›äº†ä¸€ä¸ªå¤æ‚åº¦O(1)çš„è°ƒåº¦ç®—æ³•ï¼Œå°†è¿›ç¨‹è°ƒåº¦å»¶æ—¶é™è‡³æœ€å°ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯è¿›ç¨‹è°ƒåº¦çš„é¢‘ç‡æ˜¯100Hzï¼Œæ„å‘³ç€10æ¯«ç§’ä¼šä¸­æ­¢ä¸€ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹è€Œåˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦åˆ‡æ¢åˆ°å¦ä¸€ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹ã€‚å¦‚æœåˆ‡æ¢è¿‡å¤šï¼Œä¼šè®©CPUå¿™äºåˆ‡æ¢ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´é™ä½ååé‡ã€‚

entry.title: Why Promises will make async easy
entry.content:
What is Promises


Promise is a proxy for a value not knowing when its creation time. It provide 2 Methods then and catch, which return promise so they can be chained.



Promise.prototype.then(onFulfilled, onRejected)


Appends fullfillment and rejection handlers to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the called handler.



Promise.prototype.catch(onRejected)


Appends a rejection handler callback to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the callback if it is called, or to its original fulfillment value if the promise is instead fulfilled.



Why Promises


there are so many reasons you should use promise in you client rich project if you are not using any MV* frameworks.


æœ‰è®¸å¤šç†ç”±ä½ å°†ä¼šéœ€è¦ç”¨åˆ° Promises. å¥½å§å…ˆæ¥è§£é‡Šä¸€ä¸‹ä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯ Promises ã€‚ è¿™ç±»ä¼¼äºæˆ‘ä»¬ç»å¸¸ä½¿ç”¨çš„ jQuery.ajax() è¿”å›çš„é‚£ä¸ªç©æ„ â€“ Deferreds.


æ¯”å¦‚æƒ³è¦åœ¨å¯¹ ajax è¯·æ±‚æ¥çš„æ•°æ®åšåŠ å·¥


Â  $.ajax("yourdata.url").then(function(data){
Â Â Â Â Â  // do something with your data
Â  })


å¯¹ç­‰å¾…å¤šä¸ªè¯·æ±‚è¿”å›çš„æ•°æ®åšåŠ å·¥


Â  $.when($.ajax("yourdata1.url"),$.ajax("yourdata2.url")).then(function(data){
Â Â Â  // do something with these dataÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  
Â  })


å¥½å§å¦‚æœè¿™ä¹ˆè¯´ Promises ä¸æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆæ–°ç©æ„ï¼Œ jQurey æ—©éƒ½æœ‰äº†, ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¿˜è¦ç”¨ä»€ä¹ˆ q.js.



Diference between Deferreds and Promises


å¸¸ç”¨çš„ Promises åº“ä¸º:


    
  
  • Q
    • 
  
  • when
    • 
  
  • rsvp.js
    • 



ä»–ä»¬éƒ½æ‰§è¡ŒåŒä¸€ä¸ªæ ‡å‡† Promises/A+, è€Œ jQuery çš„ Deferreds è™½ç„¶ä¹Ÿåšç±»ä¼¼çš„äº‹æƒ…ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¹¶ä¸å…¼å®¹ Promises/A+. è€Œ Chrome 32 å·²ç»åŸç”Ÿæ”¯æŒäº†è¿™ä¸€æ ‡å‡†ï¼ŒFirefox è¿˜åœ¨ Beta é˜¶æ®µã€‚



How to use


Iâ€™ve choseÂ  Q as my Promises implement library. Take GIRA as example, GIRA will request data from Github API and then manipulate them into the page I want. So basiclly two step but actually if you want have more complex data to combind, Promise will make your life easier.



What is the old way looks like


Â  $.getJSON(this.REPO_BASE, function(issues){
Â Â Â Â Â  $.getJSON(this.REPO_BASE + 'user/repos', function(labels){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  // do something with issues and labels
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  renderIssueAndLabel();
Â Â Â Â Â  })
Â  })Â Â  
Â Â Â Â Â Â  


seems like dump code isnâ€™t it. now see what eligent will be



Promisify Ajax Request


I just promisify all Github API function to make them return Promises.


Say I want all the label of my project from Github API. simply parse jquery deferred in to Promise.


Github.prototype ={
...
        getLabels: function(){
                return Q($.ajax({
                        url: 'github.issues.labels.url'
                }));
        }
...
}



Thenable


Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Gira.prototype.groupIssuesByLabels = function() {
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  return Q.all([this.github.getIssues(this.owner,this.repo,this.milestone),this.github.getLabels(this.owner,this.repo)])
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  .then(function(data){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  //combind these Issues and Labels
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  },function(error){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  // promise not fullfill
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  })
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  }


since then() in =groupIssuesByLabels=Â  will also return a thenable object. So you can do this then:


Â  gira.groupIssuesByLabes().then(renderIssues,errorHandler);



Error Handling


I think this is the best and my favor part of Promise


Â Â Â Â Â  Q('some data').then(function(data){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  return something1(data);
Â Â Â Â Â  }).then(function(data){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  return something2(data);
Â Â Â Â Â  }).catch(function(error){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  // if any of Q(), something1() or something2() goes wrong.
Â Â Â Â Â  }).then(function(){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  // do this any way
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  doanyway();
Â Â Â  })


this is the same as:


Â  function doanyway(){
Â Â Â Â Â  
Â  }
Â  function something1(data, callback){
Â Â Â Â Â  try{
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  //do something
Â Â Â Â Â  }catch(function(error){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  doanyway();
Â Â Â Â Â  })
Â  
Â Â Â Â Â  callback(data);
Â  }
Â  function something2(data){
Â Â Â  try{
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  //do something
Â Â Â Â Â  }catch(function(error){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  doanyway();
Â Â Â Â Â  })
Â  
Â  }
Â  try{
Â Â Â Â Â  $.getJSON('some data', function(data){
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  something1(data, something2)
Â Â Â Â Â  }) 
Â  }catch(function(error){
Â Â Â Â Â  // 
Â  })

package coffee;

class CoffeeMaker {

    heater.get().off();
  }
}

interface Heater {
  void on();
  void off();

}

class ElectricHeater implements Heater {
  boolean heating;

  @Override public void on() {

  }

  @Override public void off() {
    this.heating = false;
  }

  @Override public boolean isHot() {

}

    5. 




æ³¨æ„ è¿™é‡Œçš„patchå¿…é¡»åœ¨ import ä½ çš„ application ä¹‹å‰, æ¯”å¦‚æˆ‘çš„åº”ç”¨æ˜¯
wsgi.py

ä½†æ˜¯æµ‹è¯•åˆéœ€è¦å¼•å…¥è¿™äº›æ–‡ä»¶.(åæ¥æˆ‘å‘ç°äº†æ›´ elegant çš„è§£å†³æ–¹å¼ ä½¿ç”¨
local config æ¥å­˜æ”¾ä½ çš„å¯†åŒ™).

å…¥ç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶, å› æ­¤ç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­çš„import config ä¼šå…ˆæŠ›å¼‚å¸¸.

entry.title: pure and secure javascript oauth with yql
entry.content:
It would be awesome if we can use OAuth in JavaScript purely in client side.
  before start to do that, please let me explain â€œOAuth2â€ with this picture in feeeew word (skip to section 2 YQL if you know OAuth2):





OAuth 2


OAuth 2 is widely use as authorize third party application without expose userâ€™s password, OAuth2 using 2 steps verification.
  Take github as example:


There are 2 role in this story: Developer Oyang and User Lulu


As Developer  Oyang who write an App GIRA http://gira,oyanglul.us which can let user login using Github account.


As User, Lulu donâ€™t want to login in your site with my Github username and password, since Lulu donâ€™t trust Oyang but trust Github.


Solution should be: Oyang redirect Lulu to Github website so Lulu can login there, then github redirect to Oyangâ€™s gira.com and with a signal: â€œhey, luluâ€™s password is correct, log she in dude!â€.


So that is OAuth 2 actually.



Redirect users to request GitHub access


GET https://github.com/login/oauth/authorize


with parameter


    
  
  • 
cliend_id: id of your application
    • 
  
  • 
scope: permissions your application should have
    • 



this will redirect Lulu to github oauth page. Lulu can now login in github then check the permission Oyangâ€™s app request, and decide to accept or not.



GitHub redirects back to your site


if Lulu say â€œyesâ€, github will redirect back to Oyangâ€™s app with parameter of a â€œvalided codeâ€. which means appsâ€™s permited and now app can get the Luluâ€™s access_token now.


POST https://github.com/login/oauth/access_token


with parameter


    
  
  • 
cliend_id: id of your application
    • 
  
  • 
client_secret: password of your application
    • 
  
  • 
code: the thing you just got from github.
    • 




  
access_token is just as important as Userâ€™s PASSWORD so keep that saft place and never expose to anyone.

  
client_secret is your appâ€™s password so never expose to anyone either





Done


now Oyangâ€™s App Gira just got the access_token of Lulu, so Gira can make requests to the API on a behalf of a Lulu.



Pure Client Side Implement


Now here comes the problems of Javascript OAuth 2 implementation pure client side.


    
  
  1. capture code in step 2

    2. 
  
  2. secure client_secret when try request access_token

    3. 



when github redirect back with code


the first one is easy to solve by check window.location


$(window).on('eshashchange', function() {
  if(location.hash='#authdone'){
                $.get("https://github.com/login/oauth/access_token",{
                        client_id:'666dc0b3b994cc362ca2',
                        client_secret:'your secret',
                        code:location.search.split('=').pop();
                });
        }
});



as you can see the client_secret has been expose to anyone who check you javascript code.


This is really serious problem since evil hacker can just use your client_id and client_secret to make an fake app of gira to steal your userâ€™s information, horrible isnâ€™t it.


now what, anyone can easily see your javascript from browser, where to hide your secret. no option but a server.



YQL



What is YQL


YQL is Yahoo Query Language. You can simpily use SELECT * FROM web to get you data from any website. for example you can try put the follow query in YQL Console:


select * from html where urlâ€œhttp://www.weibo.com/milhouseâ€=


amazing isnâ€™t it, YQL will return the whole content of the website in XML or JSON.


check the bottom of YQL Console, simpily use request to THE REST  QUERY will return the same thing. You donâ€™t have to include any other third party annoying library to get your data. This is why I choose YQL other then Parse or Firebase as server side script.



Use YQL storage to keep secret safe


YQL provide online storage y.storage which allow you to store your YQL table, javascript and enviorment there. Since every thing is on sever, nobody but you can see them now.


When open YQL editor, you may curious about the 3 Key on the right side:




for each table/javascript/enviorment file youâ€™ve create, there are 3 line for you.


    
  
  1. 
EXECUTE: use this link when you want to execute the content.this is really important for secure your secret, Iâ€™ll explain it latter.
    2. 
  
  2. SELECT: when you just want to get the content.
    3. 
  
  3. UPDATE: when update the content.
    4. 



for better understanding, let me continue the Github OAuth example.


Hereâ€™s the plan:


    
  
  1. put all you secret inside enviorment file.
    2. 
  
  2. create a table, data of the table come from javascript file,
    3. 
  
  3. when the javascript is execute, request for the access_token

    4. 
  
  4. on the clientside, just request the YQL table for access_token. bang!
    5. 




Create YQL Table


OK.lets do IT. First of all, we need create a table who can execute Javascript inside.


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
        <table xmlns="http://query.yahooapis.com/v1/schema/table.xsd">          
      <meta>  
        <sampleQuery>select * from {table} where code='meow';</sampleQuery>  
      </meta>  
      <bindings>  
        <select itemPath="" produces="XML">  
          <urls>  
            <url>http://oyanglul.us/gira</url>  
          </urls>  
          <inputs>  
            <key id='CODE' type='xs:string' paramType='variable' required="true" />(ref:code)  
          <key id="CID" type="xs:string" paramType="variable"  required="true" />(ref:client-id)
              <key id="CSC" type="xs:string" paramType="variable"  required="true" />(ref:client-secret)
            </inputs>
            <execute><![CDATA[
         y.include('store://KqAGbe0nt2yi3bAnQQXxOx'); (ref:js-select)
      ]]></execute>         
        </select>    
      </bindings>  
    </table>



FYI, the line (js-select) reference to the SELECT KEY of the javascript file as follow, why SELECT, you know when you use EXECUTE KEY to referent an file, Yahoo will try to run it for you, but I donâ€™t want the result of javascript but the code itself to define my table.


line (code) define the table should receive a key named â€œCODEâ€, and line (client-id) and line (client-secret) as well.



Create Javascript file


tokenRequest = y.rest('https://github.com').path('login').path('oauth').path('access_token');(ref:y-rest)
var resp = tokenRequest.header('Accept','application/xml').query(
{
        client_id:CID,
        client_secret:CSC,
        code:CODE
}).post().response;
response.object = {resp}



I know line (y-rest) is weird if you never use YQL before, so do I. This looks so lame to append path to address rather then jQuery way just $.get("https://github.com/login/oauth/access_token").


ok the CID is parameter from YQL Table defined here, so does CSC and CODE.


finally, the Table and Javascript is done, how to use them, and where the hell should I put my secret to.



Create Enviroment File


Here comes the mighty enviorment file:


USE "store://jqozna9Rv9K0gS77jz8RI1" AS github;(ref:github-table)
SET CID="666dc0b3b994cc362ca2" ON github; (ref:set-cid)
SET CSC="your client secret goes here" ON github;(ref:set-csc)



the store://jqozna9Rv9K0gS77jz8RI1 is the SELECT KEY of your table just created. line (set-cid) and line set-csc pass the client_id and client_secret to github table where the javascript can actually use.



Why My Secret is secure


if you use the SELECT KEY of the enviorment file like


select * from yql.storage where name="your enviorment file SELECT KEY"



the secret defined in your enviorment file will still expose.


but not one know your SELECT KEY except yourself. so you never use the SELECT KEY everything will be safe.


Thus, use the EXECUTE KEY!!!! no one can know what happen inside your enviorment file.


env "store://0zaLUaPXLo4GWBb1koVqO6";
select * from github where CODE="code from oauth first step"




Fin


copy the  at the bottom, request this url from you client side javascript code. Thatâ€™s is, without expose client_secret safely get access_token from pure client side javascript.

entry.title: Introduces $.oauth() to make using OAuth from jQuery as easy as using $.ajax()
entry.content:
(function (window, document, $, undefined) {
    if (!$.Deferred) throw 'jQuery 1.5 is required to use the jQuery.oauth script!';
    function require(name, url) {
        if (window[name] === undefined)
            return $.ajax({ type: 'GET', cache: true, dataType: 'script', url: url });
    }
    console.log("blah")
    $.oauth = function (options) {
        var d = $.Deferred();

        $.when(
            require('str_sha1', 'http://oauth.googlecode.com/svn/code/javascript/sha1.js'),
            require('OAuth', 'http://oauth.googlecode.com/svn/code/javascript/oauth.js')
        ).then(function () {
            $.ajax(addOAuthStuffs(options)).done(d.resolve);
        });

        return $.extend({
            success: function () { return this.then.apply(this, arguments); },
            complete: function () { return this.done.apply(this, arguments); },
            error: function () { return this.fail.apply(this, arguments); }
        }, d.promise());
    };

    function addOAuthStuffs(options) {
        options = $.extend({ type: 'GET', consumerKey: '', consumerSecret: '', tokenSecret: '', url: '' }, options);
        if (options.data) {
            if (typeof options.data !== "string")
                options.data = $.param(options.data);
        }

        if (options.url.indexOf(':') == -1) {
            if (options.url.substr(0, 1) == '/') {
                options.url = location.protocol + '//' + location.host + options.url;
            } else {
                options.url = location.href.substr(0, location.href.lastIndexOf('/') + 1) + options.url;
            }
        }

        var message = { action: options.url + (options.data && options.data.length > 0 ? '?' + options.data : ''),
            method: options.type, parameters: [["oauth_version", "1.0"], ["oauth_consumer_key", options.consumerKey]]
        };

        OAuth.setTimestampAndNonce(message);
        OAuth.SignatureMethod.sign(message, { consumerSecret: options.consumerSecret, tokenSecret: options.tokenSecret });

        var parameterMap = OAuth.getParameterMap(message);
        var baseStr = OAuth.decodeForm(OAuth.SignatureMethod.getBaseString(message));
        options.data = baseStr[2][0];

        if (parameterMap.parameters)
            $.each(parameterMap.parameters, function (item, values) {
                return $.each(values, function (subitem, value) {
                    if (value == 'oauth_signature') {
                        options.data += '&oauth_signature=' + escape(values[1]);
                        return false;
                    }
                });
            });

        if (options.url.indexOf('?') > -1)
            options.url = options.url.substr(0, options.url.indexOf('?'));

        options.cache = false;
        return options;
    }
})(window, document, jQuery, location);
["(function (window, document, $, undefined) {", "    if (!$.Deferred) throw 'jQuery 1.5 is required to use the jQuery.oauth script!';", "    function require(name, url) {", "        if (window[name] === undefined)", "            return $.ajax({ type: 'GET', cache: true, dataType: 'script', url: url });", "    }", "    console.log("blah")", "    $.oauth = function (options) {", "        var d = $.Deferred();", "", "        $.when(", "            require('str_sha1', 'http://oauth.googlecode.com/svn/code/javascript/sha1.js'),", "            require('OAuth', 'http://oauth.googlecode.com/svn/code/javascript/oauth.js')", "        ).then(function () {", "            $.ajax(addOAuthStuffs(options)).done(d.resolve);", "        });", "", "        return $.extend({", "            success: function () { return this.then.apply(this, arguments); },", "            complete: function () { return this.done.apply(this, arguments); },", "            error: function () { return this.fail.apply(this, arguments); }", "        }, d.promise());", "    };", "", "    function addOAuthStuffs(options) {", "        options = $.extend({ type: 'GET', consumerKey: '', consumerSecret: '', tokenSecret: '', url: '' }, options);", "        if (options.data) {", "            if (typeof options.data !== "string")", "                options.data = $.param(options.data);", "        }", "", "        if (options.url.indexOf(':') == -1) {", "            if (options.url.substr(0, 1) == '/') {", "                options.url = location.protocol + '//' + location.host + options.url;", "            } else {", "                options.url = location.href.substr(0, location.href.lastIndexOf('/') + 1) + options.url;", "            }", "        }", "", "        var message = { action: options.url + (options.data && options.data.length > 0 ? '?' + options.data : ''),", "            method: options.type, parameters: [["oauth_version", "1.0"], ["oauth_consumer_key", options.consumerKey]]", "        };", "", "        OAuth.setTimestampAndNonce(message);", "        OAuth.SignatureMethod.sign(message, { consumerSecret: options.consumerSecret, tokenSecret: options.tokenSecret });", "", "        var parameterMap = OAuth.getParameterMap(message);", "        var baseStr = OAuth.decodeForm(OAuth.SignatureMethod.getBaseString(message));", "        options.data = baseStr[2][0];", "", "        if (parameterMap.parameters)", "            $.each(parameterMap.parameters, function (item, values) {", "                return $.each(values, function (subitem, value) {", "                    if (value == 'oauth_signature') {", "                        options.data += '&oauth_signature=' + escape(values[1]);", "                        return false;", "                    }", "                });", "            });", "", "        if (options.url.indexOf('?') > -1)", "            options.url = options.url.substr(0, options.url.indexOf('?'));", "", "        options.cache = false;", "        return options;", "    }", "})(window, document, jQuery, location);"]
